text: Joan Letitia LaCock (later Joanne Dru; January 31, 1922 â€“ September 10, 1996) was an American television, stage and movie actress. She played Anne Stanton in All the King's Men in 1949. She also played Patricia Nash Dean in The Pride of St. Louis in 1952. Her brother was television host Peter Marshall. Dru was born in Logan, West Virginia. She died in Los Angeles, California resulting from respiratory failure and lymphedema. She was 74. ==References== Category:American television actors Category:American stage actors Category:American movie actors Category:1922 births Category:1996 deaths Category:Deaths from respiratory failure Category:Actors from West Virginia
title: Joanne Dru
